page.title: 04Gotherington School 1
page.content: The school used to be housed in two buildings.One,built in 1881, was the junior base and the other,opened in 1968, acted as the infant base.In 1984 an extension was built onto the infant base in the shape of a very colourful sports hall and now,in 1985,a terrapin has been built in the school grounds for the J3 and J4 class to work in. As the teachers aren't allowed to handle the school all by themselves a group of 9 people called Governors help to oversee the running of the school.They have a wide range of responsibilities and powers. The children work well and, although it is a small school,they enter sports with teams that usually do well.In 1985 the school had 102 juniors and infant children. Our school is a fortunate one and we hope it will stay that way.
